subject: Etch on a Thinkpad T23
body:
OMG, what a hassle!  But I've got it working now.  Here are my notes 
(including some nekkid T23 pictures!)
    http://home.comcast.net/~jyavner/T23/

Getting it all to work was so much effort that there must be lots of 
other people out there with T23's whose Debian just doesn't work right.  
Maybe I should make up a DVD install disk that wipes a T23's hard drive 
and installs a system that "just works", the way Debian is supposed to?

I looked around on eBay.  Lots of people are selling generic Etch 
install disks for $10, but I can't find anyone selling Etch pre-tuned 
for a specific platform, which seems much more valuable.  It took me 
about 50 hours to get Debian-on-T23 working; how much is your time 
worth?

What do others think?  I suppose it would be less unusual to buy used 
T23's, install Debian, then resell them, but I want to avoid those 
inventory hassles.
